CVE-2019-13581|"CVE-2019-13581 is a vulnerability that exists in the OpenBSD operating system's kernel. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges. The vulnerability is due to a lack of proper input validation in the system call handling code. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted system call request to the operating system
column2: which could result in the execution of arbitrary code. OpenBSD has released a patch to address this vulnerability
column3: and users are strongly advised to update their systems as soon as possible to prevent potential exploitation."|"11"

column1: CVE-2019-13582|"CVE-2019-13582 is a security vulnerability that affects the Netdata monitoring system
column2: allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a targeted system. The vulnerability is due to a flaw in the way the system handles user input
column3: which can be exploited to inject malicious code into the system.

column1: Attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending specially crafted requests to the Netdata monitoring system
column2: which can allow them to execute arbitrary code on the targeted system. This can potentially give attackers full control over the system and access to sensitive data.

column1: To mitigate this vulnerability
column2: users are advised to update their Netdata installations to the latest version and ensure that all security patches are applied. It is also recommended to restrict access to the monitoring system to trusted users and networks
column3: and to monitor the system for any suspicious activity."|"11"

column1: CVE-2020-10558|"CVE-2020-10558 is a vulnerability in the Exim mail transfer agent (MTA) software that allows for remote code execution. Exim is a widely used MTA software that is used in many Linux and Unix systems.
The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the way Exim handles certain types of input data. Specifically
column2: it is caused by the use of an uninitialized pointer in the code. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending specially crafted email messages to a vulnerable server
column3: which can then execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.

column1: This vulnerability was discovered by security researchers at Qualys and was assigned CVE-2020-10558. Exim developers have released a patch to fix the vulnerability
column2: and users are strongly encouraged to update their Exim installations as soon as possible to mitigate the risk of exploitation."|"11"

column1: CVE-2020-15912|"CVE-2020-15912 is a security vulnerability that exists in the web-based management interface of some Cisco Small Business routers. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected device
column2: potentially leading to a complete compromise of the device and the network it is connected to.

column1: The vulnerability is caused by a buffer overflow issue in the routers' web server. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted HTTP request to the affected device
column2: which can cause the web server to crash or execute arbitrary code.

column1: Cisco has released a firmware update to address this vulnerability
column2: and users of affected devices are advised to install the update as soon as possible to prevent exploitation of this vulnerability. Additionally
column3: users should ensure that remote management access to the router is disabled
column4: and that strong passwords are used to protect access to the device."|"11"

column1: CVE-2020-29438|"CVE-2020-29438 is a security vulnerability that affects the Citrix Application Delivery Controller (ADC) and Gateway. It is a directory traversal vulnerability that allows an unauthenticated attacker to access sensitive files on the affected device.
The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Citrix Gateway and ADC management interface. Specifically
column2: the flaw is in the way the management interface handles requests for files that are outside of the intended directory.

column1: An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability can gain access to sensitive files on the affected device
column2: including configuration files
column3: logs
column4: and other system files. This could allow the attacker to gather sensitive information about the affected system and potentially execute arbitrary code.

column1: Citrix has released patches for this vulnerability
column2: and users are strongly encouraged to apply them as soon as possible. Additionally
column3: users are advised to review their system logs for any signs of unauthorized access and to monitor their systems for any unusual activity."|"11"

column1: CVE-2020-29439|"CVE-2020-29439 is a security vulnerability that affects the VMware vRealize Operations Manager product. The vulnerability allows an authenticated user with low privileges to escalate their privileges and gain access to sensitive information. Specifically
column2: the vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vRealize Operations Manager system with elevated privileges
column3: which could lead to data theft or system compromise.

column1: The vulnerability is caused by a lack of input validation in the vRealize Operations Manager product. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to the vRealize Operations Manager system. Once the request is received
column2: the attacker can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

column1: To mitigate the risk of this vulnerability

column3: VMware recommends that users of vRealize Operations Manager restrict access to the product to only authorized personnel and implement strong security controls to prevent unauthorized access."|"11"

column1: CVE-2020-29440|"CVE-2020-29440 is a security vulnerability that was discovered in the Apache Tomcat web application server. This vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the authentication mechanism and gain access to sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the affected system.

The vulnerability exists due to a flaw in the Tomcat's handling of the HTTP/2 protocol when using the Java 9+ HTTP/2 client. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted HTTP/2 request to the server
column2: which can cause a heap-based buffer overflow and allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code or obtain sensitive information.

column1: The vulnerability affects Apache Tomcat versions 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.39
column3: and 7.0.0 to 7.0.106. Apache has released a security patch to address this vulnerability
column4: and users are advised to update their systems as soon as possible to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

column1: If left unpatched
column2: this vulnerability could potentially allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information
column3: compromise the integrity of the affected system
column4: and cause widespread damage to the organization. Therefore
column5: it is highly recommended that users apply the security patch as soon as possible."|"11"

column1: CVE-2020-9306|"CVE-2020-9306 is a vulnerability in the web management interface of the D-Link DIR-3040 AC3000-based VPN router. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the router with root privileges. The vulnerability is caused by a buffer overflow in the router's web management interface

column3: which could allow an attacker to take control of the router and intercept or modify network traffic. D-Link has released a firmware update to address this vulnerability."|"11"

column1: CVE-2012-2210|"CVE-2012-2210 is a vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server that allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code on the affected system. column3: and users are advised to update their systems as soon as possible to prevent exploitation."|"12"

column1: CVE-2018-16593|"CVE-2018-16593 is a security vulnerability that was discovered in the OpenEMR system. OpenEMR is an open-source electronic health record (EHR) system that is used by healthcare providers to manage patient data. The vulnerability was identified in September 2018 and was rated as critical.

The vulnerability allowed an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system by exploiting a remote code execution vulnerability in the system's PHPMailer library. The PHPMailer library is a third-party library that is used by OpenEMR to send emails.

The vulnerability affected versions of OpenEMR that were released prior to version 5.0.1.4. OpenEMR released a patch to fix the vulnerability in October 2018. Users were advised to update their systems as soon as possible to avoid any potential security breaches.
If the vulnerability was exploited
column2: an attacker could gain access to sensitive patient data stored in the OpenEMR system. This data could include patient names
column3: addresses
column5: and other personal information. The exploitation of this vulnerability could have serious consequences for both patients and healthcare providers.

column1: Healthcare providers were advised to take steps to prevent such vulnerabilities and to ensure that their systems were up-to-date with the latest patches and security updates. It is also recommended that healthcare providers implement best practices for data security
column2: such as encrypting sensitive data and using strong passwords."|"12"

column1: CVE-2018-16594|"CVE-2018-16594 is a security vulnerability that was discovered in the Linux kernel. Specifically
column2: it affects the way the kernel handles certain types of packets that are sent to a system. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a target system
column3: which can cause the system to crash or become unresponsive.

column1: The vulnerability was introduced in version 4.9 of the Linux kernel
column2: which was released in 2016. It was discovered and reported to the Linux kernel maintainers in September 2018
column3: and a patch was released shortly thereafter.

column1: The severity of this vulnerability is relatively low
column2: as it requires the attacker to have network access to the target system in order to exploit it. However
column3: it is still a serious issue
column4: as it could potentially be used to launch denial-of-service attacks or other types of attacks that disrupt the normal operation of a system.

column1: Users of Linux systems are advised to update their systems to the latest version of the kernel that includes the patch for this vulnerability
column2: in order to protect themselves from potential attacks."|"12"

column1: CVE-2018-16595|"CVE-2018-16595 is a security vulnerability that affects the Linux kernel's implementation of the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) sequencer interface. The vulnerability allows an attacker to trigger a use-after-free condition in the kernel
column2: which can lead to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition or potentially allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

column1: The vulnerability is caused by the way the ALSA sequencer interface handles certain ioctl() system calls. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted sequence of ioctl() calls to the kernel
column2: which can trigger the use-after-free condition.

column1: This vulnerability affects Linux kernel versions 4.15 and later
column2: and it was discovered by a security researcher named Jann Horn
column3: who reported it to the Linux kernel security team in September 2018.

column1: To mitigate this vulnerability
column2: users should update their Linux kernel to version 4.19.9 or later
column3: which contains a patch that addresses the issue. Linux distributions such as Ubuntu
column5: and Red Hat have also released updated kernel packages that include the fix for CVE-2018-16595."|"12"

column1: CVE-2018-11314|"CVE-2018-11314 is a security vulnerability that affects Cisco WebEx Meetings Server versions 2.6 and earlier. The vulnerability allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server with elevated privileges.

This vulnerability is caused by insufficient input validation of user-supplied data in the web interface of the affected software. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to the affected server. If successful
column2: the attacker can gain access to sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the server with elevated privileges.

column1: To mitigate this vulnerability
column2: Cisco has released a software update that addresses the issue. Users are advised to update their software to the latest version as soon as possible. Additionally

column5: and other security measures to prevent unauthorized access to their systems."|"13"
